line_1: In honourable bumps his rich amends,
line_2: Then each might show to his admiring friends

line_1: There, in himself now seeks amends,
line_2: This found, his courtship Strephon ends,

line_1: There, in himself now seeks amends,
line_2: Convinc'd, that where a Wit pretends,

line_1: Such as will make him large amends
line_2: For loss of sisters, and of friends.

line_1: For Virtue's loss can never make amends;
line_2: As Worldly grandeur to thyself and Friends;
The early love of loving friends

line_1: My will hath made the world amends;
